features.title: Project Foundation & Core Data Model
features.description: Set up Xcode project with SwiftUI, MVVM architecture, Core Data persistence layer with 9 entities (User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, Food, FoodRecord, ExerciseRecord, SleepRecord, DailyLog, Goal), and utility services for date handling and input validation.
features.rationale: Essential infrastructure for all other features. Core Data provides reliable local storage addressing competitor pain points of app crashes and data loss (InBody, Noom, MyFitnessPal data corruption incidents). Local-first approach ensures privacy and reliability.
acceptance_criteria: Xcode project created with iOS 17+ target and SwiftUI lifecycle
Core Data model implements all 9 entities from ERD
MVVM folder structure established (Views, ViewModels, Models, Services, Utils)
PersistenceController manages Core Data stack with save/fetch operations
DateUtils handles 02:00 sleep boundary logic correctly
ValidationService validates all input ranges (height 100-250cm, weight 20-300kg, etc.)
user_stories: As a developer, I want a well-structured project so that I can build features efficiently
As a user, I want my data stored locally so that it's always available even offline

features.title: Body Composition Tracking with BMR/TDEE
features.description: Complete body composition logging system including height, weight, body fat percentage, muscle mass, with automatic BMR (Mifflin-St Jeor) and TDEE calculations. Visualize changes over time with Swift Charts graphs showing trends and goal progress.
features.rationale: Core differentiator: unified body composition + metabolic tracking that competitors lack. Addresses user pain point of 'hard to see correlations between body composition changes and lifestyle factors'. Better than InBody's unreliable app with 3-22% body fat variation complaints.
acceptance_criteria: Users can input height, weight, body fat %, muscle mass with validation
BMR calculated automatically using Mifflin-St Jeor formula
TDEE calculated based on activity level multiplier
MetabolismSnapshot saved with each body record for historical tracking
Swift Charts displays weight/body fat trends over 7/30/90 days
Dashboard shows current BMR/TDEE alongside daily intake/expenditure
Performance: queries complete in under 0.5 seconds
user_stories: As a fitness enthusiast, I want to track my body fat and muscle mass changes so that I can see my progress
As a dieter, I want to know my BMR/TDEE so that I can plan my calorie intake accurately
As a goal-oriented user, I want to visualize my body composition trends so that I stay motivated

features.title: Korean Food Database Integration
features.description: Integrate Korean Food & Drug Administration (식약처) food nutrition database API as primary source, with USDA FoodData Central as fallback for international foods. Prioritize Korean dishes (kimchi jjigae, bibimbap, tteokbokki) that are poorly covered by competitors.
features.rationale: MAJOR DIFFERENTIATOR: No competitor prioritizes Korean food data. Cronometer and others are US-centric, YAZIO has inaccurate data. Korean users struggle with existing apps. Uses verified government databases only - no user-submitted data that causes accuracy issues in MyFitnessPal and YAZIO.
acceptance_criteria: 식약처 API integrated as primary food search source
USDA API integrated as fallback for non-Korean foods
Search returns Korean foods first, then international
Food entity stores calories, protein, carbs, fat, sodium per serving
Users can adjust serving size with automatic recalculation
Recent foods cached locally for offline access
Error handling for API failures with graceful fallback
user_stories: As a Korean user, I want to find accurate nutrition data for Korean dishes so that I can track my meals properly
As a user, I want accurate food data from verified sources so that my calorie tracking is reliable

features.title: Meal Logging & Nutrition Tracking
features.description: Full diet tracking with meal categorization (breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks), food search, manual entry, serving size adjustment, and daily calorie/macro summary. Support flexible meal slots without arbitrary limitations.
features.rationale: Addresses core user pain point of 'manual calorie and macro tracking is tedious'. Unlike YAZIO's 4-meal limitation, Bodii offers flexibility. Consistent UI avoids Noom's confusing calorie display issues. Shows transparent macro breakdown addressing Lose It's UI regression complaints.
acceptance_criteria: Users can log food to breakfast, lunch, dinner, or snacks
Food search shows Korean foods first with nutrition preview
Manual food entry available with all macro fields
Serving size adjustable (0.25x, 0.5x, 1x, 1.5x, 2x, custom)
Daily summary shows total calories, protein, carbs, fat
Meal view shows individual food items with edit/delete
Recent and frequent foods appear in quick-add section
user_stories: As a user, I want to quickly log my meals so that tracking doesn't interrupt my day
As a dieter, I want to see my daily macro breakdown so that I can balance my nutrition

features.title: Sleep Tracking with 5-Status System
features.description: Sleep logging with 5-status tracking (very poor, poor, average, good, excellent), duration input, wake time prompts, and correlation with other health metrics. Automatic morning prompt to log previous night's sleep.
features.rationale: Unique 5-status sleep tracking is a differentiator. Competitors either don't track sleep or have limited options. Sleep affects metabolism, energy expenditure, and food choices - showing correlations provides value competitors miss. Addresses user goal of complete health picture.
acceptance_criteria: Morning prompt appears after 6 AM to log previous night's sleep
Users can log sleep duration (hours:minutes)
5-status quality rating with visual feedback
02:00 boundary logic correctly assigns sleep to previous day
Skip option available (max 3 times before forced entry)
Sleep trends visible on weekly/monthly view
Sleep data correlates with energy and food logging patterns
user_stories: As a user, I want to track my sleep quality so that I can see how it affects my health
As a health-conscious person, I want morning prompts so that I don't forget to log sleep

features.title: Unified Daily Dashboard
features.description: Central dashboard showing all daily health metrics: calorie balance (intake vs. TDEE), macro breakdown, exercise summary, sleep quality, and body composition status. Pre-calculated values for fast loading.
features.rationale: Key differentiator: all-in-one view that competitors don't provide. Users currently need 3-4 apps. Pre-calculated DailyLog entity ensures sub-0.5s performance, directly addressing MyFitnessPal's lag complaints and Lose It's freezing issues. Clean SwiftUI native interface unlike InBody's clunky app.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard loads in under 0.5 seconds with pre-calculated values
Shows today's calorie intake vs. TDEE with visual indicator
Displays macro breakdown (protein/carbs/fat) with progress bars
Shows exercise calories burned for the day
Displays previous night's sleep duration and quality
Quick-add buttons for food, exercise, and body composition
Date navigation to view past days
Pull-to-refresh updates all metrics
user_stories: As a user, I want one screen showing all my health data so that I have a complete picture
As a busy person, I want fast app loading so that tracking doesn't waste my time

features.title: Apple HealthKit Integration
features.description: Bidirectional sync with Apple HealthKit for weight, body fat, active calories, sleep, and workout data. Read existing data and write Bodii records to maintain ecosystem connectivity.
features.rationale: Essential for iOS health app ecosystem. Users expect Apple Health integration. Differentiator vs. cross-platform apps that have limited HealthKit support. Native SwiftUI provides optimal integration quality that Flutter/React Native can't match.
acceptance_criteria: HealthKit entitlements properly configured
Permission request explains all data types needed
Read weight, body fat, active calories from HealthKit
Write Bodii records to HealthKit (weight, workouts, sleep)
Background sync when app is closed
Conflict resolution for duplicate entries
Graceful handling when user denies permissions
user_stories: As an Apple Watch user, I want my workout data to sync to Bodii automatically
As a user, I want my Bodii data in Apple Health so that my doctors can see it

features.title: AI Photo Food Recognition
features.description: Camera-based food identification using Google Cloud Vision API to recognize food items from photos and estimate portion sizes. User can confirm or correct AI suggestions before logging.
features.rationale: Addresses top user pain point: 'manual calorie tracking is tedious'. Photo recognition is becoming standard (YAZIO, Lose It have it). 70%+ accuracy target with user correction ensures data quality. User confirmation avoids Noom's inconsistent logging issues.
acceptance_criteria: Camera opens with food-optimized settings
Google Cloud Vision API identifies food items in photo
AI suggests food matches from Korean and USDA databases
User can confirm, modify, or reject AI suggestions
Portion size estimation with user adjustment
Works offline with cached food data (recognition requires network)
1,000 requests/month free tier limit tracked and warned
user_stories: As a user, I want to take a photo of my meal and have it logged automatically
As a busy person, I want fast food logging so that I track consistently

features.rationale: KEY DIFFERENTIATOR: AI coaching without expensive subscription ($19.99/month like MyFitnessPal or $120+ like Noom). Addresses user goal 'Get AI-powered insights and recommendations on diet quality'. Provides value similar to Noom's coaching at fraction of cost.
acceptance_criteria: Daily diet summary triggers Gemini analysis
AI provides comment on nutritional balance
Recommendations consider user's goals (weight loss/gain/maintain)

As a user, I want personalized recommendations so that I reach my health goals faster

features.rationale: Users expect data to follow them across devices. CloudKit provides free sync within Apple ecosystem without server costs. Better than competitors requiring separate accounts that lead to password/login issues (InBody random logout complaints).

features.title: Exercise Tracking with MET Calculations
features.description:
# Exercise Tracking with MET Calculations

Exercise logging with activity type selection, duration input, and automatic calorie burn calculation using MET (Metabolic Equivalent of Task) values. Track both cardio and strength training with appropriate calculations.

## Rationale

Completes the calorie in/out equation by tracking expenditure. Integrated with body composition and diet data to show net daily balance - something fragmented apps require multiple tools to achieve. Addresses user goal of 'maintaining consistent daily records of health metrics'.

## User Stories

- As a fitness enthusiast, I want to log my workouts so that I can track my activity level
- As a user, I want automatic calorie burn calculations so that I know my daily expenditure

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ]  Users can select from common exercise types (running, cycling, swimming, weights, etc.)
- [ ]  Duration input in minutes with automatic calorie calculation
- [ ]  MET values used for accurate calorie burn based on body weight
- [ ]  Exercise records linked to daily log for aggregation
- [ ]  Daily exercise summary shows total activity calories
- [ ]  Custom exercise entry available for unlisted activities
features.rationale: User-created feature for Exercise Tracking with MET Calculations
